Advisory_Detail_Description: Marine bloom or “red tide” reported in this area. Red tides appear reddish-brown color and can cause marine animal impacts, particularly for fish. CA Water Boards agency recommends people and pets avoid contact with the water during times of any dense blooms or discoloration in the water. People exposed to marine algae blooms via water contact may experience irritation of the eyes, skin, or respiratory system. Report any illnesses of human or animals (domestic and wild) to https://tinyurl.com/HABReport1. AdvisoryDetail: Marine bloom present (red tide)
Advisory_Detail_Description: Marine bloom or “red tide” reported in this area. Red tides appear reddish-brown color and can cause marine animal impacts, particularly for fish. CA Water Boards agency recommends people and pets avoid contact with the water during times of any dense blooms or discoloration in the water. People exposed to marine algae blooms via water contact may experience irritation of the eyes, skin, or respiratory system. Report any illnesses of human or animals (domestic and wild) to https://tinyurl.com/HABReport1. More information about marine harmful algal blooms is available on Dept. of Public Health’s Marine Biotoxin Monitoring Program webpage at: https://tinyurl.com/5e8uc9k4.

Report any illnesses of human or animals (domestic and wild) to https://tinyurl.com/HABReport1. More information about marine harmful algal blooms is available on Dept. of Public Health’s Marine Biotoxin Monitoring Program webpage at: https://tinyurl.com/5e8uc9k4.
